channel.title: text editors on GrooveStomp
channel.description: Recent content in text editors on GrooveStomp

item.title: Editor Sizes
item.description: A few months ago I was starting to get irked at the relatively poor performance of Emacs on my primary development system. Emacs isn’t terrible, but it is noticeably slow compared to Vim. So, for the sake of curiosity I decided to look at some executable sizes. I started by just doing a simple: ls -alh `which <editor>` But that only captures the size of the executable on disk without regard for any shared libraries or dynamic memory allocations.
